Hello,

Generally you can't know the dimensions of an image until after it's 
been fetched. You could write a custom decide rule that rejects small 
images, perhaps using ScriptedDecideRule, and apply it to your 
WARCWriter, since by the time the writer processes a url, it has already 
been fetched. But of course that doesn't save the time and resources to 
crawl the url.

In some cases there are hints about the dimensions of the image, like 
the height and width attributes of the <img> tag. Currently that 
information is not easily accessible in heritrix, and it's probably of 
limited utility anyway since it can be used for scaling.

The pragmatic thing might be just to let it get the images. Or depending 
on the ultimate goal, you might want to come at it from a different 
direction.

Noah
